Well damn if I wasn't shocked to find the place crammed full of people. Who would have thought. Not me I guess, I always seem to be here when there are only other bar flys such as myself milling about enjoying the free microwave popcorn, the sumptuous decor, eclectic jukebox and lovely bartender. 
Ok well apparently people from Alameda come here on Wednesday nights too? Yeah I verbally assaulted a perfectly nice couple who probably met on the internet and were on their second or third date, what can I say I like to try and make friends. 
I do not think they were interested in my drunk talk, sorry Alameda folks I hope you got home safely. 
Anyway what I really want to say about the High tide is that like every other divey bar in my hood I will be there drinking my youth away, what's that oh yeah youth already drunk away, ok then on to my middle age, and enjoying minute of it.
author: Melissa H.

description: I went in here with some friends on Christmas morning with a raging case of the DTs and it was a perfect hideout.  Dark, creepy, comfy with random guys trying to pick up the bartender lady.
author: Andrew H.

description:
The JUKE. 

I don't know about the food, frankly I would dine elsewhere in the neighborhood since there are so many fab inexpensive venues. But the JUKEBOX. Maybe I just don't get around enough, but I was ecstatic when I stopped in here in between errands (for a $7 shot of Jack, is that not a bit steep? Do I not get out enough?) and lo, there was Janis, Willie, Al Green, Patsy Cline, Jimi, Tina, the Stones....in between the contemoporary boring no-names (don't flame me you young folks!). 3 for a buck 6 for 2, and a pool table. I'm going to be there for the next several weekends - come on and join me!
author: Maggie B.

description:
"dive bars -- mainstream", eh?  ummm. didn't anybody notice that this is a gay bar??? yeah, we Yelpers are a real sharp bunch!!!! 

:|
author: Rick H.

description: What a rathole!  But you can smoke in here and a large group of us managed to score a table and a booth at 11pm on a Friday night.  The clientele is very mixed - Nob Hill residents?  The jukebox was playing shit but I didn't get a chance to check if it was the lack of good music or the selections of the patrons.
author: Frankie D.

description: Ok, I totally tried to offer the bartender $200 for the painting behind the bar. No dice. Anyway, this is a fabulous dive bar, with non-dive bar tendencies- 1) they have every Britney CD on the jukebox. They also have Now Volumes 9-14. So fabulous. 2) the crowd varies from scary Loin denizens and those who wandered over from the Ambassador. So, one night, I saw a man try to sell my friend crack and was sitting on his hands so he'd stop scratching himself sitting next to a woman dressed in an chinchilla coat and a Marc Jacobs bag, trying to figure out where the heck she was. And my friend was ironic enough to order many, many cosmos and they were all very good. Now, that is a one great bar. Minus one star for allowing smoking inside, even when there's no smoking signs all over the place.
author: Noelle Q.

description: If you're looking for a dive bar with a great vibe in the loin, this is it.  Cheap drinks, a jukebox that doesn't stop and a pool table for some entertainment.  Smoke friendly, and a great set of adorable yet somehow troubled bartenders.  Say hi to Julia, Judy or Sue.  And Bobby's probably on one of the barstools - down the bar from me ;-)
author: Richard K.

description: There was loud music blasting out of the doors and neon lights and we decided to peek in. Didn't realize the name of the bar till we stepped out. Interesting interior and music selection.
author: Yan M.

description: Talk about good times at this dive bar. Since I work close by, I know my coworkers are always down to chill at High Tide.
author: Beth W.

description: I thought this place was GREAT! A typical dive bar, naked lady picture behind the bar, old, worn down and shitty music selection on the juke box. But it was just what I was looking for. Beer prices are pretty good, coors light goes for $3.50 cheaper than most places. One pool table in the back. Normal people... Not scary and not to over done. The younger bar tender was smoking and laughing with the customers....... Perfect little dive.
author: Laura C.

description: I started my night here. There were a couple people visiting from Holland and I thought the decorations for new years were good. The bar though does remind me of like an asian escort place or massage parlor.  I think the madam was there today. It seems like a good place to get a drink. They were playing some fun music on the jukebox...ac/dc, guns and roses...etc. Good name for a bar...
author: Jason W.

description: Awesome dive bar. Love the dollar bills on the ceiling, cash only.
author: randy s.

description: if you want watered down drinks made by the cheapest asian ladies than come here! this place sucks! I avoid it like the plague
author: Odracir M.

description: Classic neighborhood dive bar; not quirky enough to be cool.  Pool table, nasty bathrooms, jukebox, broken down booths, odd painting of naked girl behind bar, two non-plasma TVs, taciturn Asian barkeeps, cool old signage of overflowing cocktail glass swirling around corner.
author: Gil S.

description:
eww this is a sleazy place...
i feel sorry for the girls working at that bar seeing what kind of people hang out there most of the time...
there used to be a time where i spent alot of time in that area of town since i worked close by... no more can coworkers suggest this place because of convenience ... yeay~
author: charlotte s.

description:
for real yo, dive bars should feel like this.

smoky, dark, alley'ish, and full of good tunes.

i saw one of the bartenders chewing out a patron that was starting shit with another guy at the bar. props woman.

for two years now, some folks and i spend a birthday here for a friend, and so far the tide hasnt let us down. pool table with friendly regulars, and music you can sing along to till you pass out in your own pile of vomit. kick ass!
author: Darrell L.

description:
4 stars for the super cute and sweet pinay bartender!
she was able to hold down the bar filled of drunken sailors.
she looked like she was only 5'1 and weighed a buck 0-5

she gave us an empty altoid tin to use as an ashtray!
author: Alexis D.

description:
Reading the previous reviews leads me to believe most critics haven't experienced the Hi Tide on more than a couple occasions. This is not a bar for all tastes, to put it mildly. The crowd leans towards the over-40, extra-drunk archetype, with associated loud singing to bad pop songs and inappropriate cross-bar ogling. 

Some may develop the impression that the Hi Tide is a Asian "escort" bar, and I can't say with certainty they are wrong. Exhibit A - the pricey drinks. Paying more than $5 for a basic well drink should always raise a red flag in any divey establishment like the Hi Tide. Exhbit B would have to be the framed portrait of a nude matriarch whose name escapes me at the moment. Scant evidence, I know, but don't blame me if you end up getting a back-room handjob during those black-out hours of your Saturday night. 

Expensive drinks, unappealing crowd and bad music make this an infrequent destination despite its close proximity to my apartment. For those of you searching for a "my very own dive bar adventure", this place will probably pass muster. Others will likely be looking for the door after they finish chugging their weak, seven-dollar well cocktail. 

NOTE: this used to be a smoking bar, but no longer.
author: Phil D.

description: Hi-Tide is a fun little dive.  The ladies behind the bar are always friendly and, as other yelpers have mentioned, the crowd is always interesting.  If you happen to be at the theater and you don't feel like going to a fancy or pricey place after your show, you should definitely check out Hi-Tide for its relaxed, friendly atmosphere.
author: Sara H.

description: A total dive bar if i've ever seen one.  No it's not a great dive bar but i have gone in there at least 3 times to have a few drinks.  Like Gil said there is nothing in here that makes it special except for the naked painting behind the bar.  Me and my friends thought it was the bartender for a second but she corrected us promptly.  Not the type of place where i want to end my night or stay the night but i could see myself starting a night there and working my way towards polk street.
author: Jonathan F.

description: The picture over the bar has been dubbed the Burt Reynolds as its the kinda woman i always imagined him waking up next to some random morning in kentucky, or mexico. Im not sure if yu-me or yummie is still working the bar but i miss my times with her. This is my start it off and often finish it off dive bar. Really i just cant help but enjoy a dive that lets me order flaming shots and then asks me for the ingredients, allowing me to do my part in keeping the only good thing to come out of the eighties bar scene alive. After a night of over the top cocktails with ingredient lists containing more items then most dinner menus it nice to find a smelly, dirty, faded, lop-sided pool table having, dive bar complete with crappy jukebox perpetually playing the obligatory sing along anthems of every low brow establishment from here to buffalo. nothing says hello evening like a Flaming doctor pepper, and nothing says good night San Francisco like a shot of fernet and a cheap beer. A tender spot in my heart for this tenderloin tavern.
author: M C.

description: the picture behind the bar is totally worth the price of admission.  that being said, it costs nothing to get in.  oh, snap!
author: Laura B.

description: The tide came into our lives last night, the hi-tide that is. After a typical happy hour at Swig (fun, fabulous, cool people), and some very filling Indian food at Chutney, our group had to figure out where the night was heading. The neon lights of the Hi-Tide beckoned, and we went in. Our bartenders gave us the once over but once the budweisers and whiskeys started flowing all was good. The jukebox was just plain odd - my first selection of songs included AC/DC's Shook Me All Night Long, Sympathy for the Devil, Stacey's Mom, and then later N'Sync's Bye Bye Bye, and I think Elton John's Our Song (WTF?). Drunken dancing and bumping ensued, and the bar magically got busier and busier. At closing time, our bartenders were almost sad to be closing, but I assured them, "I'd see them tomorrow." Is the Hi-Tide for you? I'm not really sure, but there are a few perfect moments in one's life where good friends come together haphazardly and lives intersect and you know that life is pretty damn near heaven. Last night was one of them.
author: Nish N.

description: i don't remember coming here and i don't remember leaving, but i think i had a good time.  there's a pool table, so that might be fun if you're sober enough to stand...
author: Roshni R.

description: ok, so i've only been to the Hi-Tide twice, but have left both times with great stories to tell. very eclectic crowd, great rock 'n' roll jukebox, strong drinks, a neon sign w/ a martini glass -- all of the requisite dive bar characteristics.  my favorite part of this place is the mingling b/w all of the different types of folks that patronize the place - the bond over booze can't be broken, you know? very cool reminder of the diverse city that we live in.
author: Saleema F.

description: neighborhood love in here. been a regular for 10 years. beers are 3 bucks, and pool table with a awesome juke box.
author: Chizzy T.

description: not the sort of establishment i typically frequent, but this corner dive bar is fully loaded with character. it was purely by accident that i ended up coming here.... but isn't that how all the best things in life happen? it was sunday night. i started things out at Swig and realized at one point i had lost all my friends. damn, where did they go? all of a sudden i'm with this guy jeremy and all his friends. oh well, they welcomed me into their circle like family and we all headed over to High Tide. Now maybe i was really tipsy but i remember there being a pool table in here.... well, i hope there was because i was definitely playing pool. jukebox was cranked up and the painting of the naked lady was hanging up behind the bar right where everyone said it was...... fast forward to many drinks, many songs and many pool games later. i was right in the middle of a shot, about to scratch for the zillionth time and i looked up at my New Family and said very seriously, "who exactly are you people?" they all thought that was pretty funny..... looking back it was i guess. luckily this bar isn't too far from home because later on my New Family walked me right up to my front door and watched me stumble into the elevator so i could pass out. ah, another successful sunday night. mom would be proud.
author: Michelle I.
